feed.title: A suggestion for reducing the size of the UTXO database

entry.title: A suggestion for reducing the size of the UTXO database
entry.summary: In an email conversation, Pieter Wuille discussed the complex trade-off between UTXOs and fees. The use of more UTXOs leads to larger transactions and higher fees, but if a miner determines that the reduction in UTXO storage requirements is worth the lower fee, there is no protocol level enforcement of a fee. However, using more UTXOs results in more linkage between coins/addresses used, which ultimately lowers privacy. A solution to this issue is to select all the UTXOs from a single address. Keeping the UTXO set small has an economical reason as it makes it easier for individuals to run a full node, which ultimately leads to faster Bitcoin spread and increased value.
